page.title: 19Homelife In Springfield
page.content: A survey made of{pets}kept by families in Springfield in May 1985 showed that a large variety of pets were popular. The most popular was the dog with 33 families owning one. Followed by 22 families with pet cats. Third in popularity were fish-21 families, and fourthly 19 rabbits. This was closely followed by budgies with 14 being kept. 6 families were found to keep a mouse, 5 a gerbil and 3 to keep a canary and a hen. 2 families found room for a horse, and 1 for a goat. The least popular animals were found to be terrapin, tortoise, donkey, ferret, hamster and guinea pig, each kept by 1 family in and around the village.
